purpose: Define the only categories of user input the AI is allowed to receive within the Whole Body Reset system. This schema prevents diagnosis-seeking, protocol chasing, fear-based escalation, and incomplete personalization.
input_principles: The system prioritizes patterns over labels.
Safety, pacing, and nervous system regulation require complete input.
If required input is missing, the system responds conservatively rather than escalating.

current_symptoms.description: User-described physical, emotional, or cognitive experiences.
current_symptoms.constraints: Symptoms must be described in plain language without assumed cause.

symptom_duration.description: How long symptoms have been present.

symptom_intensity.description: Subjective severity as perceived by the user.

pattern_observations.description: Noticing when symptoms improve, worsen, or cycle.

current_supports.constraints: The system does not evaluate correctness, effectiveness, or dosage.

medications_and_conditions.description: Declared medications or diagnosed conditions for safety awareness only.
constraints: The AI may not comment on medication changes or medical management.
Absence of this information limits system responsiveness for safety.

tolerance_and_capacity.description: How well the user tolerates current inputs or changes.

goals_and_intent.description: What the user hopes to understand or clarify.

ai_response_requirements.when_disallowed_input_detected: Redirect to observation, stabilization, and appropriate external support without answering directly.
ai_response_requirements.when_required_input_missing: Limit responses to reflection, safety framing, and encouragement to complete intake.
ai_response_requirements.fallback_language: This may be something to explore with a qualified practitioner while continuing foundational support.
